info.description:
The [Reports API](/reports/overview) enables you to request a report of activity for your Vonage account.

Depending on your query pattern, you can choose from one of the two versions of the Reports API: asynchronous and synchronous. The asynchronous version is optimized for infrequent and large data queries (from several records to tens of millions). The synchronous version is optimized for frequent and periodic retrievals of small batches of data records (from one record to tens of thousand per query).

Only synchronous version supports retrival of data records by message/record ID.

Vonage recommends that you limit asynchronous queries to a maximum of 20 million records, by setting the start and end dates accordingly. On average, the asynchronous Reports API takes 5 - 10 minutes to generate 1 million records.
info.title: Reports API

parameters.description: The account for which the list of reports will be queried.
parameters.name: account_id

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of report status values. Reports with any of the statuses specified are returned. The values in the comma-seperated list specified for `status` can be any of `PENDING`, `PROCESSING`, `SUCCESS`, `ABORTED`, `FAILED`, `TRUNCATED`.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: ISO-8601 extended time zone offset or ISO-8601 UTC zone offset formatted date from which the list of reports will be queried. Format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]±hh:mm` or `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]Z`.
parameters.name: date_from

parameters.description: ISO-8601 extended time zone offset or ISO-8601 UTC zone offset formatted date until which the list of reports will be queried. Format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]±hh:mm` or `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]Z`.
parameters.name: date_to

items_count.description: The number of reports in the list.

detail.example: Invalid request parameter.
You did not provide correct credentials.

get.description: List reports created by the specified account based on filtered provided.

parameters.description:
The parameters of the JSON body will be used to create and filter the report.
The value of the `product` field will define which product the report will be created for and which parameters are accepted.
parameters.name: body

detail.example: Malformed JSON payload.
You did not provide correct credentials.
User not authorized to query the requested data.
Unprocessable entity.

post.description: Request a report on your account activity

parameters.description: The account for which the list of reports will be queried.
parameters.name: account_id

parameters.description: The product to return records for
parameters.name: product

parameters.description: Direction of the communication, either `inbound` (received by our services), or `outbound` (originated from our services). Required for products `SMS` and `MESSAGES`. Optional for `VOICE-CALL`. Invalid for `CONVERSATIONS`, `NUMBER-INSIGHT`, `VERIFY-API`.
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description:
The UUID of the message or call to be searched for. You can specify a comma-separated list of UUIDs. If UUIDs are not found they are listed in the response in the `ids_not_found` field.

If you specify `id`, you must not specify `status`, `date_start` or `date_end`.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
ISO-8601 extended time zone offset or ISO-8601 UTC zone offset formatted date (format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]±hh:mm` or `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]Z`) for when reports should begin. 

It filters on the time the API call was received by Vonage and corresponds to the field `date_received` (`date_start` for Voice) in the report file. It is inclusive, i.e. the provided value is less than or equal to the value in the field `date_received` (`date_start` for Voice) in the CDR.

If you provide this, you must provide `date_end` and must not provide `id`.
parameters.name: date_start

parameters.description:
**Must be no more than 24 hours later than `date_start`**

ISO-8601 extended time zone offset or ISO-8601 UTC zone offset formatted date (format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]±hh:mm` or `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]Z`) for when report should end.

It is exclusive, i.e. the provided value is strictly greater than the value in the field `date_received` in the CDR.

If you provide this, you must provide `date_start` and must not provide `id`.
parameters.name: date_end

parameters.description: Include the message contents in the records. Only applicable for use with products `SMS` and `MESSAGES`, where it is optional.
parameters.name: include_message

parameters.description: The event type to search for. Only used, and is required, when product is `CONVERSATIONS`.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The SMS status to search for. Optional where product is `SMS`.
parameters.name: status

detail.example: User not authorized to query the requested data
You did not provide correct credentials.
Report aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-0123456789ab does not exist, or you do not have access.
The job is already in a terminated state such as `SUCCESS`, `TRUNCATED`, `FAILED` or `ABORTED`.

delete.description: Cancel the execution of a pending or processing report.
delete.summary: Cancel the execution of a report

parameters.description: UUID of the report request (`request_id` in response).
parameters.name: report_id

detail.example: You did not provide correct credentials.
Report aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-0123456789ab does not exist, or you do not have access.

get.description: Retrieve status and metadata about a requested report.

report.description: The report in CSV format inside the zip archive.

detail.example: You did not provide correct credentials.
Report aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-0123456789ab does not exist, or you do not have access.

get.description:
Download a zipped archive of the rendered report. The file is available for download for 72 hours.
The zip file will be named `_.zip`
The csv file in the zip archive will be named as `report___.csv` the date will be formatted as `yyyyMMdd`.

href.description: URL pointing to the generated report.

account_id.description: The account ID (API key) you wish to search for. This can differ from the API key in the authorization header because some accounts can request reports for other accounts, e.g. a primary account owner wants to create a report for one of its subaccounts.

application_id.description: Search only for requests attached to a particular Application ID.

asr_status.description: Search only for ASR with corresponding status.

call_end_date.description: Date of the end of the call.

call_start_date.description: Date of the start of the call.

callback_url.description: URL to send a callback upon completion of the report. This POST callback contains the same information as the response to [Get status of report](/api/reports#get-report).

conversation_id.description: Search only for Voice calls attached to this particular Conversation. This should include the "CON-" prefix.

conversation_type.description: Type of conversation request. Only used, and is required, when product is `CONVERSATIONS`.

country.description: Country where the request was sent.

country_name.description: Country name where the request was sent.

currency.description: Currency of the price of the request.

date_end.description:
ISO-8601 extended time zone offset or ISO-8601 UTC zone offset formatted date (format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]±hh:mm` or `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]Z`) for when report should end. It is exclusive, i.e. the provided value is strictly greater than the value in the field `date_received` in the CDR.
If unspecified, defaults to the current time.

date_finalized.description: Date when the request was finalized.

date_start.description:
ISO-8601 extended time zone offset or ISO-8601 UTC zone offset formatted date (format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]±hh:mm` or `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.sss]Z`) for when reports should begin. It filters on the time the API call was received by Vonage and corresponds to the field `date_received` (`date_start` for Voice) in the report file. It is inclusive, i.e. the provided value is less than or equal to the value in the field `date_received` (`date_start` for Voice) in the CDR.
If unspecified, defaults to seven days ago.

direction.description: Direction of the communication, either `inbound` (received by our services), or `outbound` (originated from our services). Required for products `SMS` and `MESSAGES`. Optional for `VOICE-CALL`. Invalid for `CONVERSATIONS`, `NUMBER-INSIGHT`, `VERIFY-API`.

duration.description: Duration of the call in seconds.

error_code_description.description: Description of the error code of the request.

estimated_price.description: Estimated price of the verify request.

file_id.description: Id of the generated report file.

first_event_date.description: Date of the first verify event.

id.description: Search only messages with the specified uuid.

ids_not_found.description: If you request multiple records using a comma-separated list of UUIDs, then the UUIDs of any records not found are listed in this field.

include_message.description: Include the text of messages in the report.

include_subaccounts.description: Whether to include subaccounts or not.

items_count.description: The number of rows in the resulting file (when report has been completed).

last_event_date.description: Date of the last verify event.

latency.description: Latency of the request in ms.

message_body.description: Body of the message sent. Only present if include_message parameter is set to true.

network.description: Network used to send the request.

network_name.description: Name of the network used to send the request.

ni_country.description: Country of the looked up number.

ni_country_name.description: Country name of the looked up number.

ni_first_name.description: First name of the owner of the looked up number.

ni_last_name.description: Last name of the owner of the looked up number.

ni_network.description: Network of the looked up number.

ni_network_name.description: Network name of the looked up number.

ni_network_type.description: Network type of the looked up number.

ni_number.description: Number looked up for this request.

ni_ported.description: Is the looked up number ported.

ni_reachable.description: Is the looked up number reachable.

ni_response_code.description: Response code of the Number Insight request.

ni_status.description: Status of the Number Insight request.

ni_valid.description: Is the looked up number valid.

number.description: Search only request for the target number.

number_type.description: Type of phone number to which requests are sent.

pricing_model.description: Pricing model used for this request.

product.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

product_asr.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

product_conversations.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

product_messages.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

product_ni.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

product_sms.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

product_verify.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

product_voice.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

product_websocket.description: Which product you wish to generate a report for.

receive_time.description: Time at which the report request was received by the service.

sms_event_count.description: Number of sms sent for this verify request.

sms_status.description: Search only for sms with the corresponding status.

start_time.description: Time at which the report processing of the report has started.

status.description: Search only for conversation events with the specified event status.

tts_event_count.description: Number of tts sent for this verify request.

voice_status.description: Search only for voice call with the corresponding status.

voice_status_description.description: Description of the status of the call.

websocket_status.description: Search only for WebSocket call with corresponding status.

account_id.description: The account for which the list of reports will be queried.
account_id.name: account_id
